title: Settings Page Items
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged into MLB app on Fire TV
custom_steps: WHEN user selects 'Settings' from the top nav
custom_expected:
THEN the settings page is displayed
AND Login/Log Out
AND Favorite Teams
AND Following Teams
AND Hide Spoilers
Autoplay Featured Content (this may not show if the device is in an excluded audience like AFTT devices or may be feature toggled off so will not display)
AND Get MLB.TV (Only for logged out users)
AND Terms of Service
AND Contact Support
AND the app version should be displayed in the bottom right

title: Terms of Service
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the settings page of the MLB app
custom_steps: WHEN the user highlights "Terms of Service"
custom_expected:
THEN the following text is displayed on the left side of the screen

For Terms of Service, please visit mlb.com/tou

For Privacy Policy, please visit mlb.com/privacy

Please visit mlb.com/do-not-sell-or-share-my-personal-data to opt out of targeted advertising and tracking.

title: Contact Support
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the settings page of the MLB app
custom_expected:
THEN the following text is displayed on the left side of the screen

Have questions? For in-game support, please visit us on the web at mlb.tv/support

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am on the Settings Page
AND I select the Favorite Teams Option
AND I select a favorite team
AND I click NEXT/Done
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I will be redirected to the Settings page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am on the Settings Page
AND I select the Favorite Teams Option
AND I click the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I will be redirected back to the Settings page

title: Hide Spoilers
custom_preconds: GIVEN an MLB user is in MLB.TV App
custom_steps: WHEN I turn Hide Spoilers ON
custom_expected: THEN I can not see any scores or data that would give away an outcome of a game

title: Following Team Selection
custom_preconds: GIVEN a MLB user is in MLB.TV App

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN they navigate to settings
AND Select the following team picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN they can choose one to many teams to follow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user has selected favorite and following teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the sort order of games presented on the homepage and the scores page presents favorite team first, then following teams, then the remaining games in time order

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is is on the favorite teams page
AND they select a team tile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN it will highlight the team tile to the dark team color AND And the cursor will focus on the activated “next” button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is is on the favorite teams page
AND they select a team tile 
AND they already have a favorite team selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the new favorite team tile will be dark and the former favorite team tile be be unselected And the cursor will focus on the activated “next” button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is is on the following teams page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN they should see a list of unselected team tiles in order of division AND a center pane will appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is is on the following teams page
AND they select a team tile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN it will highlight the team tile to the dark team color

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is is on the following teams page
AND the user navigates from left to right or right to left across the info pane
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the cursor stays in the same row as it was before

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is is on the following teams page
AND they focus on a team tile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the center pane will show team details on focused team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is is on the following teams page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN they can select many following teams

title: Autoplay global setting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an MLB user is in MLB.TV App
AND the featured space is occupied by media content that should autoplay (this requires entitled sign in, hide spoilers off)
NOTE: If featured space is not occupied by content which can autoplay https://mastapi.mobile.mlbinfra.com:443/api/epg/v2/search* with the attached json

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the global autoplay feature is on
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN render the autoplay on/off setting

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the global autoplay feature is off
NOTE: This can be achieved by proxying https://firebaseremoteconfig.googleapis.com:443/v1/projects/518717772311/namespaces/firebase:fetch AND/OR	https://firebaseremoteconfig.googleapis.com:443/v1/projects/73121217114/namespaces/firebase:fetch at app startup time with the variable "enable_homepage_autoplay" set to "false"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the autoplay setting will not render

title: Homepage Autoplay: setting preference default
custom_preconds: GIVEN global autoplay is turned on
custom_steps:
WHEN I visit the settings page
AND the user has yet to select the autoplay setting
custom_expected: THEN homepage autoplay is set to true by default
